tweets.text: (3) So, given that $TSLA is still 5x (on EBITDA) to 10x (on Revenues) more expensive than the other auto OEM’s, the stock has a long way to fall if these price cuts do not generate unit growth.

(2)And just so we all understand the numbers at this point, here is $TSLA vs the other major auto OEM’s, through the 3Q. A 1000 bp cut in gross margins would put $TSLA right in line with every other OEM. If that’s the case, then it boils down to growth, not growth and margins. https://t.co/14aVsUMyXq

This thread is well worth the read on $TSLA, as the Tesla Faithful have effortlessly transitioned from, “What other auto OEM is growing at 40-50%…?! Tesla is a technology company.” to, “This was all part of Elon’s Master Plan to compete with/destroy the other legacy OEM’s.” https://t.co/ZGvE1sp20D
Tesla's solar factory in Buffalo fizzles - Investigative Post | This is quite the story $TSLA https://t.co/WEE2721J8t

(5) And more germane to the author’s view on cash-on-cash incremental returns…Switch had EBITDA in 2019 of $197M, on average capital employed of $1,475M. In the LTM it was $282M on $2,796M. So $85M of more EBITDA on $1,321M of net new capital, or a 7% gross incremental return.
(2) And today, Wells Fargo upgrades $RUN based in part on a multiple of “Operating EBITDA” ($928M in 2022). Again, actual EBITDA at Sunrun is negative. #MakeStuffUp https://t.co/K61X8PRaOg
Tesla is still trading at 40 times LTM earnings per share (ex-tax credits). With future estimates being cut. Let that sink in. $TSLA https://t.co/bAD0bjqeX8
Celsius crypto deposits don't belong to customers, judge rules $COIN  https://t.co/fs3mRbTzsq

Tesla($TSLA) Kicks Off New Year in China by Extending Incentive Offers | In light of the 4Q delivery miss, this story from Saturday looms larger. Additional discounts in China through February.  https://t.co/Bb2ePvQaNo

(2) And given that virtually all of $TSLA’s profits come from China, a comparison with $NIO might be instructive. $NIO is expected to grow 100%(!) in 2023, but is valued at only 2x 2022 revenues. The market does not pay up for Chinese “profits”. https://t.co/3UGY1HMnDQ
“Tesla will make $5 per share in 2023” is the new anchored bull case. LTM EPS (ex tax credit sales) is $2.50. With a book-to-bill of below 0.5. $TSLA @HalftimeReport
Norway, one of $TSLA’s more mature markets, saw only 2.5% unit growth in 2022 vs 2021 https://t.co/bK3Gd44rMl
Tesla ($TSLA) increases discount on cars delivered this month | $3,750 goes to $7,500 in the US, before 12/31  https://t.co/NVgQ7pm4wb
